title: PROJECT-01 — Momentum vs Mean-Reversion
summary: Built a complete research pipeline comparing momentum vs mean‑reversion across multiple lookbacks. Implemented signal generation, cost‑aware backtests, and robust evaluation with walk‑forward style splits.
impact: Built for teaching under‑resourced students; fully reproducible and MIT‑licensed.
overview: Signals are computed from rolling returns (momentum) and z‑score deviations (mean‑reversion). I evaluated sensitivity to lookback windows, added transaction costs, and compared drawdowns.
objective: Quantify when momentum dominates mean‑reversion and how costs/rehypotheses affect real PnL.
metrics: CAGR, Sharpe, hit‑rate, max‑drawdown; parameter sweeps by lookback.

title: PROJECT-02 — Portfolio Optimization with Efficient Frontier & Risk Parity
summary: Reproduced Modern Portfolio Theory and Risk Parity on a small multi‑asset universe. Estimated mean/var/cov, traced the efficient frontier, and contrasted max‑Sharpe, min‑vol, equal‑weight and risk‑parity allocations.
impact: Built for teaching under‑resourced students; fully reproducible and MIT‑licensed.
overview: I built a clean optimizer wrapper (scipy) and plotted the frontier with realized backtest stats. I show how constraints and risk budgets change the allocation.
objective: Demonstrate mean‑variance tradeoffs and when risk‑parity outperforms naive weighting.
metrics: Realized return, volatility, Sharpe; turnover and diversification indexes.

title: PROJECT-03 — Pairs Trading Cointegration & Z-Score
summary: Designed a pairs trading engine using Engle‑Granger cointegration tests and z‑score entry/exit rules. Backtest includes slippage/costs, position sizing, and risk controls.
impact: Built for teaching under‑resourced students; fully reproducible and MIT‑licensed.
overview: Spread is modeled with an OLS hedge ratio, then standardized to z‑scores. Equity and diagnostics show mean‑reversion quality and regime breaks.
objective: Evaluate profitability and stability of cointegrated pair trades under realistic frictions.
metrics: Sharpe, drawdown, average trade PnL, half‑life of reversion.

title: PROJECT-04 — Options Volatility
summary: Explored options IV: smile, term‑structure, and surfaces. Built simple covered‑call and volatility‑tilt experiments with P/L attribution.
impact: Built for teaching under‑resourced students; fully reproducible and MIT‑licensed.
overview: I parse sample options data, derive implied vols, and visualize smiles/surfaces. Strategies are benchmarked vs underlying to show sources of edge and risk.
objective: Understand how IV geometry maps to strategy risk/return in practice.
metrics: Return, vol, Sharpe, max‑DD, premium capture, assignment frequency.

title: PROJECT-05 — ML for Markets
summary: Built a lightweight ML pipeline for market direction using handcrafted features. Included robust train/test splits, feature scaling, and threshold calibration.
impact: Built for teaching under‑resourced students; fully reproducible and MIT‑licensed.
overview: Models evaluated with ROC/PR, equity curves from probabilistic signals, and ablations to see which features matter.
objective: Show disciplined ML experimentation and how to convert scores into tradable signals.

title: PROJECT-06 — Sharpe Ratio Optimization
summary: Implemented Sharpe ratio optimization with constraints (long‑only/box/normalization). Analyzed stability vs. estimation error and turnover.
impact: Built for teaching under‑resourced students; fully reproducible and MIT‑licensed.
overview: Compared naive weights, max‑Sharpe, and regularized solutions; visualized risk‑return and exposure bars.
objective: Illustrate optimizer behavior and how constraints/regularization affect out‑of‑sample performance.
metrics: Sharpe, realized vol, turnover, exposure concentration.

title: PROJECT-07 — Monte Carlo Option Pricing
summary: Coded Monte Carlo pricer for vanilla options with path‑generation diagnostics and convergence tests. Compared MC estimates to closed‑form where available.
impact: Built for teaching under‑resourced students; fully reproducible and MIT‑licensed.
overview: I validated sampling error vs. path count, plotted terminal distributions, and tested different vol/drift setups.
objective: Build intuition for MC accuracy/cost tradeoffs and noise control techniques.
dataset: Synthetic path generator parameters; sample_paths.csv for reference.
metrics: Bias vs. analytic price, RMSE, confidence intervals.

title: PROJECT-08 — Value at Risk & Expected Shortfall
summary: Computed historical VaR and Expected Shortfall; stressed the distribution and compared horizons. Assessed stability and tail‑risk properties.
impact: Built for teaching under‑resourced students; fully reproducible and MIT‑licensed.
overview: I visualized return distributions vs. parametric assumptions and quantified exceedances.
objective: Explain practical differences between VaR and ES and their estimation pitfalls.

title: PROJECT-09 — CAPM Factor Models
summary: Ran factor regressions (CAPM/FF3), inspected betas and residual diagnostics, and linked factor exposure to cumulative performance.
impact: Built for teaching under‑resourced students; fully reproducible and MIT‑licensed.
overview: Fitted linear models, checked goodness‑of‑fit, and visualized factor contributions over time.
objective: Understand where returns come from and whether alpha remains after factors.
metrics: Alpha, beta, R², residual autocorr/normality tests.

title: PROJECT-10 — Daily Returns & Volatility
summary: Explored daily returns and realized volatility on a synthetic SPY series. Looked at seasonality, clustering, and simple volatility predictors.
impact: Built for teaching under‑resourced students; fully reproducible and MIT‑licensed.
overview: Computed rolling stats, distributional properties, and basic risk‑managed signals.
objective: Build intuition for return distributions and volatility dynamics at 1‑day horizon.
